title: Finding the Entropy Change
text: To find the standard entropy change (∆S°) of the reaction, you need to use the Gibbs free energy equation: ∆G° $$=$$ ∆H° - T∆S°.

title: Rearranging the Equation
text: Rearrange the equation to solve for ∆S°: ∆S° $$=$$ (∆H° - ∆G°)/T.

title: Plugging in the Values
text: Remember to convert ∆G° and ∆H° from kJ to J by multiplying by $$1000$$, and then substitute the values into the equation:\n∆G° $$=$$ $$-394400$$ $$\frac{J}{mol}$$, ∆H° $$=$$ $$-393500$$ $$\frac{J}{mol}$$, and T $$=$$ $$298$$ K.

title: Calculate ∆S°
text: Substitute the given values into the rearranged equation:\n∆S° $$=$$ $$((-393500)$$ - (-394400))/298
